isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING BRAKE DRUMS AND SHOES - BRAKE LINING - INSPECTION

svcprocinfo.para: Vehicle brake systems require the correct lining material to perform as originally designed. The type of lining material that is specified is based on several technical considerations and DOT braking performance regulations. Always use the lining specified by International.
Check brake lining for possible out-of-square condition which would indicate a distorted shoe and/or bent backing plate ( Figure 22).

svcsubproc.title: Eaton
svcsubproc.para: Standard production (EB) brakes use different lining assemblies than Extended Service (ES) brakes. Because of the parts differences, normal wear of each type creates its own unique wear pattern.
Figure 23shows the difference between (EB) and (ES) lining when new and after normal worn.

figure.caption: Figure 23. EB and ES Lining - Eaton

svcsubproc.title: Rockwell
svcsubproc.para: Combination lining sets with different friction ratings on the primary and secondary shoes are sometimes used. When combination friction lining sets are used, the lining blocks must be installed in the correct location on the brake shoes.

note.para: Always follow the instructions supplied with the replacement combination linings for correct installation.
